title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Had a video interview to discuss expectations for the role and I explained why I am interested interested, and why I would be a good fit. It was very casual and comfortable.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role?

title: Interactive Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Miami University (Middletown, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Multiple people asking questions. Very interactive. Took about an hour to complete. Multiple rounds in one interview session. They made it feel very easy and not harsh at all. Great interview.
Interview Questions: What are some of your previous projects

title: Peer Health Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: Written application, then group interview with every other applicant, two on one interview that is run by others in college. The final interview is with the individual who runs the group.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths? What are your weaknesses?

title: Library Archivist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the Miami University Jobs portal and a few months later I got an email asking for my availability to interview. It was just one remote video call interview that lasted around 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Describe your workflow process and the way you organize your files.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: It was a virtual interview with 2 current faculty members. We introduced ourselves and they asked me questions about myself and my interest for the job. They left time for me to ask questions about the position and contacted me a few days later offering me the position.
Interview Questions: What is a time you encountered conflict in the work place and how did you resolve it?

title: Senior Library Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straightforward. If your resume is selected, they invite you for an in-person (or virtual) interview. From there, if selected you are offered a position and do not need to go through round after round of interviews.
Interview Questions: The university does not close for inclement weather very often. In the event of heavy snow, or ice, would you be able to make it in to work?

title: Research Assistnat Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy interview process asked questions about yourself and your experience in research. Applied online and then had a recruiter reach out via email and then had a phone interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and past experience

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a Very laid back interview. It was Great practice for future interviews! The interviewer was friendly and kind. She made me feel very comfortable. I am so glad I got to participate in this experience.
Interview Questions: What was one time where you faced a challenge in a team?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: 4 Hour - Panel, One on One, Group - Had 9 people in last interview including faculty and staff. Interview also included video interview  with both the one on one and the group. A few brakes in between which gives you time to get prepared for the next one. Also had a follow up second interview which was an in person one on one.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with the community?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: The job interview process does not exist. All you need to do is just submit the graduate admission and you will automatically be considered for the job. That is all I know.
Interview Questions: No question was asked in the interview.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: General questions about yourself, and about student health, safety, and quality experience. Make sure you talk about how you can include students and make them feel at home. Definitely prepare before hand.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time?

title: Filing Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Miami University (New York, NY) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Hard it was definitely not easy but good luck to you all.
Dress appropriate.
Able to work under pressure that’s a plus.
But really it is hard to get in to just ensure you pray.
Interview Questions:
About their company.
Myself 
Career path 
Previous jobs 
Yea that’s it

title: Digital Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: The overall experience was very professional and they made me feel comfortable when interviewing.  There were only a few people in the interview room and I was able to ask questions and provide my ideas on certain things.
Interview Questions: What are your current skills?

title: Strategic Procurement Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: Standard panel interview format.  Described role and responsibilities.  Asked about previous work experience as well as some behavioral questions.  Allowed opportunity for me to pose questions to them. Positive experience overall.
Interview Questions: They asked about my previous work experience

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions:
1) Phone interview with committee. This was about 25 minutes.
2) In-person interview with committee as well as 1:1 interviews with select higher ups. This whole process was a full day.
Interview Questions: Pretty standard questions: explain why you're interested in this role and what you'd bring to it?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: Meet with a current resident director and they ask how you would respond in various situations. They aim to get a sense of how you handle stressful situations and how you interact with others.
Interview Questions: How do you handle diversity in a residence hall?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: Easy Process, important to know internal controls. Nothing that threw me off during the interview important to show that you have a strong work ethic and that you can problem solve.
Interview Questions: Do you what internal controls are

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Miami University in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview so you only had to show up for training. It took about an hour to complete an assessment on a computer, then you get a tour, and then you're introduced to your section.
Interview Questions: A quick review of things to consider

title: Athletics Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Good interview, very straightforward in regards to questions asked. Outside of the box to get you on your toes but nothing too crazy. Really want to get to know you as a person more, since more than likely you were contacted because your skills match the position. Want to see how you fit within the department.
Interview Questions:
How many hours did you work at previous position? 
What drives you?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: fairly standard,  interviewers (Deans and chairs of the departments) were very collegial and welcoming. You need to understand the mission and vision of the school well and see if your work matches its mission.
Interview Questions: Why do you like to work for Miami University?

title: IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview process.  Applied through online portal and showed up to a casual in person interview where we discussed my prior work experience and job expectations.  Hired within the month.
Interview Questions:
*Similar prior work experience.

*Hour expectancy.

*Responsibilities of the job.

*Current interests and how they can benefit the facilities.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: Not traditional. Mainly relies on your relationship with the professor. Basically you just want to email your professor that you are interested in TAing for. They will most likely respond if you were engaged in their class, tried hard, and had a decent grade
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Student Affairs Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of a full day of interviews with multiple members of the Office of Student Affairs that this position would be working with. It ranged from casual to more formal, asking behavioral to research based questions.
Interview Questions: Describe your background in Student Affairs.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Miami University (Cincinnati, OH)
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview, then two subsequent interviews by the department chair confirming percentage acceptance rates on current publications. I then had a one-day campus visit where I met with the search committee and dean only. I did a teaching presentation, as well.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my research.

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Overall, it was Informal and focused on previous experience. There were just two people and one of the people had had the job previously. They asked about experience with students and if I had overseen a budget.
Interview Questions: Describe previous experience in higher education?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: First there was a group interview where you rotated through different situations to see how you reacted in specific situations relating to the position. Then there was an individual interview with a Resident Director and current Resident Assistant from a randomly assigned building.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Software Developer for IMS Department Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH)
Interview Descriptions: It was a brief discussion about my experience and how long I've coded as well as a few problems to run through. Nothing too complex. I saw the job posting throughout the IMS department and sent my application through the mail. The professor in charge f the project and I then met in person two days later and discussed the position in person.
Interview Questions: How would you implement an event system to be flexible and dynamic so that we can add and take away events when needed easily?

title: Coordinator of Student Activities Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: First phone interview then on-campus interview. On-campus consisted of campus tour, meeting with search committee, open session/presentation (attended by faculty, staff and students), and meeting with supervisor. Around 2-3 hours total. Probably 3 months from application to hire.
Interview Questions: Describe your ideal welcome week.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Miami University in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was a group interview where I interacted with the other applicants through activities. There were current RAs in the room observing the group interactions. (I've gone back as an observer/interviewer. The goal isn't really to see how well you complete the given group task but rather to see how well you work in a team setting. Don't interrupt, talk over other people and dominate the conversation.) There was also a one on one interview with a current RA and a Resident Director. It was mostly getting to know you questions and some behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: What are some resources available on campus?

title: Endowment Office Student Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview for this position was more of a conversation than an exam.  The CIO wanted to hear good questions primarily and a general interest in investments.  I started emailing him 2 semester prior to when he brought be in for an interview where then he asked me to walk me through my resume and current class work for the semester.
Interview Questions: What kind of jobs do you expect to pursue post-graduation?

title: IT Helpdesk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was haphazard and the participants acted like the position had already been filled. It was a waste of my time. The main contact didn't even take time to see me out the door. The department head acted like he was being bothered with the interview process.
Interview Questions: What operating systems are you familiar with?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Miami University in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview followed a phone interview. It was a standard interview with the hiring manager and two of her direct reports. I waited for about three weeks until I was told via an email that I did not get the job.
Interview Questions: What is an accomplishment you are most proud of?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interviews. First round is a two on one interview with a current RA and hall director. Second round is a group interview in which you are placed in various scenarios and required to find solutions to problems. You must show that you are able to work with others well while also doing what's best for your residents and yourself.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you found out your coworker was keeping the alcohol he confiscated from his residents?

title: Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds of interviews. Group interviews first, then individual interviews. The main focus is to look for friendly personalities who enjoy their time at Miami. If you can talk and be polite, you will be fine.
Interview Questions: What's your favorite part about Miamk

title: Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Cover letter and resume handed in, then talked to building manager and answered a few simple questions. Mostly regarding leadership and management skills. Example: Situation A...you respond with reaction X
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that you dealt with a difficult employee. How did you handle it? Was it a success or failure? What could you have done differently?

title: Event Production Team Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: One interview with your basic interview questions, nothing too confusing or intense, I felt very comfortable and welcomed. Got a call about a week or two later with a job offer.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you lead a team? Have you ever had to deal with an underperforming team member? If so, how did you handle it? etc.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It took a very long time to get an interview. I applied online and then it took months to be contacted for an interview. The experience was overall positive, I met with several groups of people. It took most of the day. They ask many of the same questions in different ways.
Interview Questions: The interview focused on how my skills, education and experience could contribute to their mission. Do your research, you will need to know about their mission and vision.

title: Student Government Cabinet Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: This is an elected role, you must give a 3-minute presentation to student government senators.  They then vote on who should get the position once they have heard each person's presentation.
Interview Questions: What do you plan to do to help the student body?

title: Building Services Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: My current boss Mike, emailed me about 11 months after I had initially applied and met him the next week, had a 2 minute interview and he hired me on the spot.  There aren't more than 5 or 6 student managers needed at any given time and due to that I had to wait for a spot to open up which is why it took me almost a year to go from applied to hired.
Interview Questions: What is your tech background?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: All you need to do is take the pre-requisite classes for what ever research position you are apply for and talk to the a professor whom you are interested in their research. It is pretty fast and painless; I started the very next week. However, some professors may be different
Interview Questions: I never had a formal interview

title: Student Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: You apply from the school website. This is where you post most of your information and availability. Also I believe that this was the most difficult part of the process. Working at the dining hall is the most paid job (non-manager) on campus and the easiest to get. Every other position is paid slightly over minimum wage and usually has an interview along with it. The interview usually consist of basic stereotypical interview questions.
Interview Questions: There were no questions that caught me off guard.

title: Advisory Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Individual and Faculty Panel Interviews,  lots of varied questions about experience with students and ideas about job and role from job posting description.  Met a group of students also.
Interview Questions: Why are you qualified for this position?

title: Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process didn't take more than five minutes. We just reviewed if I had any days that I missed work, how much effort I put forth every day I came in, etc. It was very relaxed.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths?
What are your weaknesses?
Why do you want to be a student manager?

title: Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: 3 step process: resume submit online, group interview, and then single interview
Interview Questions: Very easy and basic questions. Asked what your favorite memory of Miami is.

title: Adviser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, Phone interview then an on campus. Great experience! Would recommend this employer. Very transparent throughout the process. I was never left confused on not sure what was next.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: one interview and a resume submission
Interview Questions: What would you do if you have two roommates who do not get along

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed interview process.
Interview Questions: Why should I hire you?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Miami University in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: If you apply for a graduate program (master of phd), then you don't need a separate application to apply for an assistantship. I was accepted first to the school and then a professor from the graduate program contacted me by email to schedule an interview. I had a skype interview and he asked me basic questions about data structures. He then asked me about the courses that I took which I was an udergraduate student. I was accepted after two weeks to the job.
Interview Questions: Nothing unpredictable

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Miami University
Interview Descriptions: Online application is due by the end of the fall semester and a lot of first year students will miss this. Interview itself was rather easy and very general. Interview is designed to get to know you as a person and see why you are interested in the position rather than to test how smart you are. RA is a job that requires a good sense of ethics and moral. Make sure to present this side of your personality (if you have one).
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an RA?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: job apply/ candidate selecting/ phone interview/ face to face to interview (sometimes group, sometimes one to one - depends on the position) / send an offer/ paper work/ apply for ID, parking permit and so on.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself/experience

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very comfortable process, more of a conversation than an interview. They really take the time to get to know you and ask what you want to get out of the internship.
Interview Questions: What would you like to get out of this experience?/What do you want to be involved with?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was offered a job when the manager noticed I was cleaning during business hours. I met one on one with her for about a half hour, and she asked me some brief questions. After that, I had to complete several online counseling sessions, followed by brief assessments. Overall, the experience was a very positive one.
Interview Questions: Have you had any previous experience in food service?

title: Assistant Professor, College Or University Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Conference interview first, then campus visit to meet the rest of the department as well as several deans.
Interview Questions: Nothing really.  You'll know immediately if you will be a good fit based on the culture you observe.  There is very little smoke and mirrors here.  They want to keep those they hire.

title: Pro Shop Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Easy, got the job right out of the interview. Just say you know about hockey and say you know how to skate. It's all about knowledge of hockey, ice rinks, and you have to be able to skate to skate guard.
Interview Questions: Are you a hard worker?

title: Student Baker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: there is no interview process. If you are a student, you apply online through the student jobs section and they will accept you but takes a while to hear back from them. It took about 2 weeks to even receive an email saying that I was hired and to come in to sign papers.
Interview Questions: There were no questions, they email and tell you when to come in and sign papers, and when your first day will be. Miami can use all the full time and students they can get because they are constantly short handed, so in short, if you apply with a resume and do not have a criminal background check you will be hired.

title: Student Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I received notification for an interview via a phone call. The interview was held with a panel of a few staff and supervisors. No trick questions, all straight forward background related or behavioral. Questions regarding what you would do in a conflict, strengths and weaknesses, availability, and other scenarios related to the job that are typically asked in an interview.
Interview Questions: no tough questions

title: Student Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is a way for them to evaluate how committed you will be to the job (will you be late/miss work days) along with your personality's fitting to their environment. Be positive, engaging, respectful and show that you will be committed to your responsibilities.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about a time where you had to work with a team but found it difficult to work together?
How did you overcome these challenges?
How can you fit your work schedule with our available times?

title: Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Many Student Managers re-interview for the job every semester, but this depends on their business unit.  This internal interview with the unit manager consists of submitting a resume and participating in a basic interview.  The interview consists of reflecting on performance: areas of strength and areas of weakness.  The work environment is great at the individual units.  It is very high energy...you work hard, but you have fun doing it.
Interview Questions: What have you done well in the past semester?

title: Media Production Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Miami University in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted after applying on the student jobs website online. The poster contacted me for a short interview and then had me complete a skills test in which I had to design an advertisement from a creative brief. Following that was a one-on-one interview in which we discussed the position and my experience.
Interview Questions: What is the most creative thing you've ever done?

title: Student Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Miami University in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: They post an announcement part way through a semester for all their current employees to see.  Very easy interview, they just ask basic questions off of your resume and about experiences you have had as a student employee working in the kitchen.
Interview Questions: What kind of manager do you think you would be?

title: Student Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Miami University (Middletown, OH) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was initially approach about the position from one of the advisers working in the office. I had to make a profile on the Miami jobs website, submit a resume, and cover letter. I was then called to schedule an interview. I was interviewed by both the director of the office and administrative assistant. It was very calm and a friendly atmosphere.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation when you don't know the answer to a student question?

title: Residence Life Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: The Office of Residence Life prefers to take their new employees from face-to-face interviews at OPE and NASPA.  I could not attend either, and was offered a phone interview instead.  The people were very nice, and two people interviewed me at the same time.  Before the interview, they informed me of who would be my interviewers.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Miami University (Oxford, OH) in Mar 2008
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview was perfunctory, but followed up by a lengthier interview with the chair, who mostly talked about commitment to research, even though it's a teaching position, and a visiting one at that.  I also spent time with the field chair and talked though my research.
Interview Questions: Perhaps you saw my last article in ---- journal?
